I can' understand the honourable member being afraid of public money being wasted on banquets. We certainly do not want to make this a rich man's post. But the honourable member for Cook, having ventilated the view naturally entertained by some people, might very well withdraw his amendment. He may be satisfied that the person appointed to be High Commissioner will desire to live for a few years. He will not be so young a man as to be anxious to be continually attending banquets.
